trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Resource Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Resource Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Azure Resource Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Azure Resource Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Azure Resource Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Azure Resource Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Resource Connector to easily manage Azure Resources inside of your Logic app.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Resource Connector to easily manage Azure Resources inside of your Logic app.

trans-unit.source: To use the Azure Resource Connector API App, you need to first create an instance of it.
trans-unit.target: To use the Azure Resource Connector API App, you need to first create an instance of it.

trans-unit.source: This can be done either inline while creating a Logic app or by selecting the Azure Resource Manger Connector API app from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: This can be done either inline while creating a Logic app or by selecting the Azure Resource Manger Connector API app from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To configure it, you have you need to set up a Service Principal with permissions to do whatever it is you want to do in Azure.
trans-unit.target: To configure it, you have you need to set up a Service Principal with permissions to do whatever it is you want to do in Azure.

trans-unit.source: All calls will be made on-behalf-of this Service Principal that you set up.
trans-unit.target: All calls will be made on-behalf-of this Service Principal that you set up.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to scope the Connector to use only exactly what you want it to do, and nothing more.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to scope the Connector to use only exactly what you want it to do, and nothing more.

trans-unit.source: David Ebbo has written [a great blog post](http://blog.davidebbo.com/2014/12/azure-service-principal.html) on how to set this up.
trans-unit.target: David Ebbo has written [a great blog post](http://blog.davidebbo.com/2014/12/azure-service-principal.html) on how to set this up.

trans-unit.source: Please follow all the instructions there and get your **Tenant ID**, **Client ID** and **Secret**.
trans-unit.target: Please follow all the instructions there and get your **Tenant ID**, **Client ID** and **Secret**.

trans-unit.source: These three fields, plus the **Subscription ID**, are what are required to configure the Connector.
trans-unit.target: These three fields, plus the **Subscription ID**, are what are required to configure the Connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Resource Connector in Logic Apps designer
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Resource Connector in Logic Apps designer

trans-unit.source: There are two triggers that are supported in the Connector:
trans-unit.target: There are two triggers that are supported in the Connector:

trans-unit.source: Trigger when an event occurs to a resource in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Trigger when an event occurs to a resource in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Trigger when a metric meets a certain threshold.
trans-unit.target: Trigger when a metric meets a certain threshold.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, you can provide a large number of actions inside your Azure subscription:
trans-unit.target: Likewise, you can provide a large number of actions inside your Azure subscription:

trans-unit.source: List all of the resource groups in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: List all of the resource groups in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Get a resource group by its id.
trans-unit.target: Get a resource group by its id.

trans-unit.source: Create or update a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Create or update a resource group.

trans-unit.source: List resources in your subscription by different types of filters.
trans-unit.target: List resources in your subscription by different types of filters.

trans-unit.source: Get a single resource by its resource Id.
trans-unit.target: Get a single resource by its resource Id.

trans-unit.source: Create a resource, or, update an existing resource.
trans-unit.target: Create a resource, or, update an existing resource.

trans-unit.source: You must provide all of the properties for that resource.
trans-unit.target: You must provide all of the properties for that resource.

trans-unit.source: Perform any other action on a resource.
trans-unit.target: Perform any other action on a resource.

trans-unit.source: You need to know the action name and the payload that this action takes (if any).
trans-unit.target: You need to know the action name and the payload that this action takes (if any).

trans-unit.source: List all of the available resource providers in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: List all of the available resource providers in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: List all of the deployments in a resource group.
trans-unit.target: List all of the deployments in a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Get a template deployment by its id.
trans-unit.target: Get a template deployment by its id.

trans-unit.source: Create a new resource group deployment by providing a template.
trans-unit.target: Create a new resource group deployment by providing a template.

trans-unit.source: Get events in a subscription or for a resource.
trans-unit.target: Get events in a subscription or for a resource.

trans-unit.source: Get a metric for a resource Id.
trans-unit.target: Get a metric for a resource Id.

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business flow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business flow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor API apps and connector](../app-service-api/app-service-api-manage-in-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor API apps and connector](../app-service-api/app-service-api-manage-in-portal.md).
